posts.title: Interesting articles
posts.text: Articles relevant to matrix stuff, such as random structure matrices, matrix decomposition, learnt matrix transform Compressive Sensing and Structured Random Matrices ALMOST ORTHOGONAL SUBMATRICES OF AN ORTHOGONAL MATRIX Structured Random Matrices Introduction to the non-asymptotic analysis of random matrices A penalized matrix decomposition, with applications to sparse principal components and canonical correlation analysis Optimal Linear Estimation under Unknown Nonlinear Transform Learning Deep Analysis Dictionariesâ€”Part I: Unstructured Dictionaries Learning Deep Analysis Dictionariesâ€“Part II: Convolutional Dictionaries Articles relevant to the attention mechanism regarding how it is architected to exploit the long-range dependencies, to reduce the complexity of computation, and what is the underlying relationships among some common operations/layers/structures such as convolution, seq2seq, RNN. Also, the works to boost the performance from different aspects will be included here. NEURAL MACHINE TRANSLATION BY JOINTLY LEARNING TO ALIGN AND TRANSLATE. Non-local Neural Networks Integrating Multimodal Information in Large Pretrained Transformers Stand-Alone Self-Attention in Vision Models. ON THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN SELF-ATTENTION AND CONVOLUTIONAL LAYERS. Processing Megapixel Images with Deep Attention-Sampling Models Articles relevant to variational autoencoder TARGETED VAE: STRUCTURED INFERENCE AND TARGETED LEARNING FOR CAUSAL PARAMETER ESTIMATION QUASI-SYMPLECTIC LANGEVIN VARIATIONAL AUTOENCODER Disentangling Multiple Features in Video Sequences using Gaussian Processes in Variational Autoencoders Super resolution variational autoencoder

posts.title: Overview of attention mechanism
posts.text: General speaking, the output of all the operations we have used such as fully connected layers, convolutions or poolings is mainly driven by its local input value. The arising of attention mechanism brings two main changes: depending on the feature themselves, not on their positions, relaxing locality constraints. These two changes are ascribed to the dynamic modulation of the weighting of different parts of a signal which permits the presentation and allocation of information channels to be dependent on the activations themselves. At the beginning, this mechanism was developed to entitle deep-learning models with memory-like function, to capture long-term/range dependencies for sequence-to-sequence translation. The translation task can be thought of as $$y_t=f(x_t)$$

posts.text: Angry angry annoyed irritated fed up pissed off put out dipleased mad belligerent Happy Excited Suprised Upset

posts.title: Words to replace "do"
posts.text: handle manage manipulate grasp hold deal with treat control govern conduct trade retail accomplish complete achieve achieve a consensus achieve a settlement achieve your purpose achieve an objective achieve a balance achieve prominence achieve independence undertake/carry out undertake a task/project undertake work. The work is being undertake by team of experts. Students may undertake full-time supervised research leading to the award of a Ph.D. You should not undertake a long journey if you are unwell. It was not a voyage to be undertaken lightly. serve satisfy answer

posts.title: Git command
posts.text: How to initialize a repository Letâ€™s say you have an existing project that you want to start tracking with git. Step 7 and 8 coulde be skipped, if you already add the public key. Go into the directory containing the project. exec â€œgit initâ€ create .gitignore file to exclude some unnecessary dirs and files exec â€œgit add .â€ exec â€œgit commit -m â€œfirst commitâ€â€ exec â€œgit remote add origin git@github.com:xuyuluo/nlinv_prior.gitâ€ exec â€œssh-keygen -t rsa -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa-foo -C email@xxx.comâ€ exec â€œssh -T git@github.comâ€ git remote set-url origin git@github.com:xuyuluo/nlinv_prior.git" exec â€œgit push -u origin masterâ€ Explanation to frequently used commands git remote add origin xxx.git: creates a new remote origin located at xxx.git git push origin master: push the commits in the local branch named â€˜â€˜masterâ€™â€™ to the remote named â€˜â€˜originâ€™â€™ git add files or dirs: add changes to next commit git commit: commit changes to the repository option -a of commit: too many changes, so commit all option --amend of commit: amend/modify last commit pull fetch

posts.title: handle tough strings with seq or awk
posts.text: Handle string stream Extract string from squared brackets Using awk echo â€œstring1 [string2] string3 string4â€ | awk -Fâ€™[][]â€™ â€˜{print $2}â€™ Using sed echo â€œstring1 [string2] string3 string4â€ | sed â€˜s/.[([^]])].*/\1/gâ€™ s/ â€” this means it should perform a substitution .* â€” this means to match zero or more characters [ â€” this means match a literal [ character ( â€” this starts saving the pattern for later use [^]]* â€” this means match any character that is not a [ character the outer [ and ] signify that this is a 1. character class having the ^ character as the first character in the class means â€œnotâ€ ) â€” this closes the saving of the pattern match for later use ] â€” this means match a literal ] character .* â€” this means to match zero or more characters /\1 â€” this means to replace everything matched with the first saved pattern (the match between â€œ(â€ and ")1. " )

posts.title: Notes for me, maybe for you
posts.text: How to ssh your lab server swiftly? Always feel annoyed with the input of IP and password, when you are about to login your lab server. Try these commands below. 123#first use ssh-keygen to generate your public keyxxx@xxx:~$ ssh-keygen#then ask your admin to authorize you public key How to compress your images with nearly invisible loss? Always pissed off by large photos from you cellphone, when you are preparing them for your blog post. Never mind, several simple ubuntu commands might help you. 1234#first to resize images to certain sizeconvert test.jpg -resize 2048x test-2048x.jpg#then compress itconvert test-2048x.jpg -quality 50 test-2048x-50p.jpg How to keep processes running after ending ssh session The first thing you need to do is to install screen Execute screen in terminal, then you get into a virtual terminal. You are supposed to run you program that you want it keep running in the virtual terminal. Then, 1: pressCtrl+A, 2: pressD, to detach current virtual terminal and bring you back to the normal terminal. Use screen -r take you back to virtual terminal. More questions? Refer to this page Create link to open pdf in latex 123\usepackage{hyperref}\hypersetup{pdfnewwindow}\href{run:main.pdf}{This is my link} How to create snippets in vs code Go to File->Preferences->User snippets->New snippets 1234567{ "gray_background":{ "prefix":["<span"], "body": ["<span style=\"background-color:#D3D3D3\">$TM_SELECTED_TEXT${1:}</span>"], "description": "autocomplete for gray background" }} Then, add shortcut. Ctrl + k, Ctrl + s, open keyboard shortcut json. 12345{ "key": "ctrl+alt+a", "command": "editor.action.insertSnippet", "args": {"name": "gray_background"}} Failed to import the numpy c-extensions under conda env Reinstall, numpy package activate conda env pip uninstall -y numpy pip uninstall -y setuptools pip install setuptools pip install numpy How to crop away the white margin of your pdf figures How to concatenate/burst your pdf files with pdftk

posts.title: Look into discretized mixture of logistic distribution(DMOL)
posts.text: Discretized logistic mixture likelihood used as loss function for generative model was first proposed in PixelCNN++, and then was applied to predict discrete value in Wavenet. Definition of log sum exp (LSE)$$\vec{\boldsymbol{x}}={x_1, â€¦, x_n}$$$$\mathrm{LSE}({\vec{x}}) = \log{(e^{x_1}+ â€¦ + e^{x_n})}$$ Definition of softmax$$\mathrm{softmax}(\vec{x}) = \frac{e^{x_i}}{e^{x_1}+â€¦ +e^{x_n}}$$ discretized mixture of logistic distribution (DMOL)$$P(x|\pi, \mu, s)=\sum_i^K\pi_i[\sigma(\frac{x+0.5-\mu_i}{s_i})-\sigma(\frac{x-0.5-\mu_i}{s_i})]$$$$\log{P(x|\pi, \mu, s)} = \sum_i^k \log{\pi_i}+\sum_i^k\log{g(x, \mu_i, s_i)}$$$$\log{\mathrm{softmax(\vec{x})}} = \log{(e^{x_i})} - \log{(e^{x_1}+â€¦+e^{x_n}})$$ inverse sampling technique
